**Job Description**
 The Digital Workplace Advisory Group is a strategic practice unit established to help orchestrate the breadth of Infosys digital workplace service offerings across the technology service-lines, complemented with experience design, digital adoption & learning services to deliver an integrated and human-centric experience to our enterprise clients in their journey to the future of work. This team is responsible for driving integrated Go To Market incubating industry solutions, Managing Analyst Briefings & provide technology advisory services to Client execs in their digital transformation of workplace.
   

  

**Your role**
 In the role of Industry Principal, you would be part of team of digital workplace transformation leaders and evangelists on future of work who specialize in leading organizations through digital workplace transformation by leveraging emerging workplace technologies. You will work on customer engagements to define, sell and guide customers on initiatives in the areas of digital workplace strategy, employee experience transformation, workplace modernization, organizational change and smart workspace design.
   

  

**Role And Responsibilities**
* Provide technology advisory services to Client Executives on their digital workplace strategy & roadmap.
* Lead large digital workplace transformation programs as a trusted Technology advisor to clients working with multiple client stakeholders, business groups and service providers.
* Provide best-fit architectural solutions, technology consultation, assist in defining scope and sizing of work, create technology differentiation to ensure high quality technical solutions and thought leadership for digital workplace.
* Manage a range of stakeholders and subject matter experts to ensure alignment to business needs.
* Liase with various integration forums and internal governance committees
* Strategic and Large deal advisory – Lead integrated solutions for large proposals or client programs (digital workplace).
* Program manage large consulting/advisory engagements for digital workplace.


**Required - Mandatory:**
* Experience in IT .
* A Digital Workplace Technology strategist and evangelist who specializes in leading organizations through digital transformation by leveraging emerging technology and articulating the strategy to deliver new products, business paradigms and ecosystem partnerships that enable growth and increase operational efficiency.
* Well versed with Industry Standards, OEM Standards, and Service Offerings in the “Digital Workplace” domain to be able to provide solution advisory and transformation strategy.
* Experience across the breadth of Digital Workplace Technology domains in Three or more of the below service offering domains –


 Employee Experience, Modern Workplace and Endpoint Management, Digital Collaboration (Team Collaboration , Cloud Voice & Meeting & Collaborative Apps ), DaaS & Device lifecycle Management (Modern device and endpoint management, Cloud Virtual Desktops, Device Analytics & experience management ), Connected Workspaces ( IoT, AR/VR ), Workplace Security), Digital Adoption & Change Management ( incl. Workplace Analytics), Service desk & experience, ( incl. Conversational AI & Automation).
   

  

**Personal**
 Besides the professional qualifications of the candidates, we place great importance in addition to various forms personality profile. These include:
   

  

* Excellent in Verbal, written communication.
* Strong stakeholder management and negotiation skills to be able to influence or manage difficult stakeholders both internal and external – partners, service providers and customers.
* Willingness and flexibility to learn new technologies (learnability, having a pulse on industry trends), scale up quickly and adapt to different roles as the situation demands.


**Why Infosys**
 Infosys is a global leader in next-generation digital services and consulting. We enable clients in 56 countries to navigate their digital transformation. With over three decades of experience in managing the systems and workings of global enterprises, we expertly steer our clients through their digital journey. We do it by enabling the enterprise with an AI-powered core that helps prioritize the execution of change. We also empower the business with agile digital at scale to deliver unprecedented levels of performance and customer delight. Our always-on learning agenda drives their continuous improvement through building and transferring digital skills, expertise, and ideas from our innovation ecosystem.
   

  

 Visit www.infosys.com to see how Infosys (NYSE: INFY) can help your enterprise navigate your next.

title: Industrial Design Lead
company_industry: Transportation, Logistics, Supply Chain and Storage
description:
Born autonomous. Born electric.
   

  

 Since 2016, our technology has connected global communities with the things they need – and all without the emissions. We’re made up of experts in multiple fields and that’s how we’ve developed a new way to move goods. This is technology purpose-built for the industry. This is safer, cleaner, and more reliable movement.
   

  

 We are Einride and this is how we build a better future.
   

  

 Want to be part of transforming road freight – for good? Einride is showing the world a new way to move, based on the latest digital, electric and autonomous technologies. Through freight capacity as a service, we enable businesses around the world to accelerate towards their sustainability goals.
   

  

 Founded in 2016, Einride became the first company in the world to deploy a cab-less autonomous electric vehicle on a public road (Sweden, 2019). In 2022, we were the first to successfully operate such a vehicle on a US public road. Today our award-winning technology has been launched across 8 countries (and counting). Our clients are some of the world’s biggest shippers, including Fortune 500 companies. We are also operating Sweden’s largest truck dedicated public charging network and counting.
   

  

 As an Industrial Design Lead your role will be twofold. One part will be hands-on in the work we do but also to lead an interdisciplinary team with the ability to work on a multitude of products within the Einride ecosystem. Your responsibilities will include being a substantial part of the product development process all the way from the first user insights and ideas to implementation and scaling for mass production.
   

  

 The second responsibility lies within a newly formed initiative - As of 2025 Einride design team is now also offering our design services to a selected few external clients. Einride plan to build the best design team within technology and innovation - Offering services within Visual design, Marketing, Product design & Industrial design.
   

  

 We will lead with making great work and that will attract the right people and clients that are onboard with the type of work we want to put into the world.
   

  

 As Lead in any part of our offering, you will be the most senior person in that role. You will steer the creative vision, while forging strong relationships with external clients or stakeholders at Einride and overseeing complex, multi-functional projects across various domains. Your entrepreneurial mindset and problem-solving approach will thrive in these environments, and you need to be hands-on and also make sure that the people in your team have the best setup for doing a great job - That means you will need to be the person with the answers.
   

  

**You Will**
* Lead the industrial design team, a small but growing group, fostering collaboration and innovation.
* Engage with and secure external clients, taking responsibility for selling, packaging, and presenting your part of our offering. This includes understanding their business challenges, guiding them toward effective creative solutions, developing impactful presentations, and leading new business pitches.
* Drive the entire product development lifecycle, from initial idea and user insights to final launch. This involves defining objectives and constraints, conducting thorough product research (functional, commercial, aesthetic), and packaging successful cases for future clients.
* Formulate and communicate compelling design concepts for products within the Einride ecosystem (Automotive / Industrial / Consumer Products). You'll prepare sketches, CAD models, diagrams, illustrations, plans, samples, customer journey maps, and physical models to effectively convey your vision.
* Negotiate design solutions with relevant teams and stakeholders.
* Strategically select and specify materials, production methods, and finishes, and oversee the preparation of prototypes, CAD files, tooling, and the overall manufacturing process.
* Ensure consistently high design quality in all deliverables, collaborating closely with our product and tech teams, and taking the lead on design projects to continuously improve them.
* Visualize the Einride vision for the future.


**What We Expect Of You**
* Long solid experience in designing innovative high-quality hardware products.
* Comfortable working with software such as: NURBS CAD tools like Rhino, Autodesk Alias, Polygon modelling tool like Blender or similar. Rendering tools like Keyshot, V-Ray, VRED, Maxwell render or similar. And Adobe Creative Cloud Package.
* Fantastic design skills and sense of form that should be showcased in your portfolio.
* You master the art of digital sketching and visualization
* A good understanding of manufacturing techniques and collaboration with engineers.
* Thrives in a fast-paced environment where you continuously get to develop meaningful ideas and deliver real impact to our users.
* Experience from a design agency/studio.


**A Bonus If**
* You have an understanding and interest in A-Class surfacing
* You have an understanding in mechanical design
* You have an interest in digital products, interface design, graphic design, UX Design


 This position is based in our Stockholm office. We highly recommend submitting your application as soon as possible, as we review candidates and conduct interviews on an ongoing basis. Please ensure your application includes a design portfolio as it is an essential requirement for consideration.
   

  

 At Einride, we are innovators, building solutions the world has never seen before - but urgently needs. That's why we take action, and it's why we are always eager to be challenged. We know that our best innovations come from having a diverse mix of people, including those of different experiences, career paths, and walks of life. By coming together and sharing our perspectives openly - by disagreeing, discussing, and committing - we deliver greater impact.

title: Visual and Motion Designer
description:
Established in 2004,
 **OLIVER** 
 is the world’s first and only specialist in designing, building, and running bespoke in-house agencies and marketing ecosystems for brands. We partner with over 300 clients in 40+ countries and counting. Our unique model drives creativity and efficiency, allowing us to deliver tailored solutions that resonate deeply with audiences.
   

  

 As a part of
 **The Brandtech Group** 
 , we're at the forefront of leveraging cutting-edge AI technology to revolutionise how we create and deliver work. Our
 **AI solutions** 
 enhance efficiency, spark creativity, and drive insightful decision-making, empowering our teams to produce innovative and impactful results.
   

  

**Role:** 
 Visual and Motion Designer
   

  

**Location:** 
 Stockholm, Sweden
   

  

**About the role:**
 Working in partnership with our client, a renowned global leader in the drinks and beverages industry to recruit a talented Visual and Motion Designer. This role involves taking digital, print, and social content projects from concept to completion.
   

  

 You'll infuse fresh ideas, spark consumer interest through compelling creativity, and adhere to brand guidelines, managing projects within time and budget constraints. Collaborate with a multi-disciplinary dynamic team of 15 creative professionals, including Art Directors, designers, copywriters, project managers, UX designers, developers, and product managers, to shape and elevate our brand's visual identity. Reporting directly to the Creative Director, you'll be a key player in driving design excellence and innovation.
   

  

**What you will be doing:**
* Concept, idea development and visual design.
* Graphic design development including artwork, mock-ups, presentations, motion design/graphics.
* Social Media asset production.
* Monitor industry trends and research developments in branding and marketing.
* Produce designs/ideas to the client's brief and exacting standards from start to completion.
* Direct, oversee and execute production of content and concepts for digital platforms.
* Ensure all content is highest quality and relevant for multiple markets.
* Direct development of post imagery and copy, including guiding team members.
* Work proactively to push brands toward new creative expressions.
* Ensure all concepts follow responsible communication guidelines.
* Develop effective working relationships with colleagues and clients.


**What you need to be great in this role:** 
  

  

* Motion Design and Animation:
+ Strong skills in 2D motion design and animation.
+ Keen eye for timing, rhythm, and visual storytelling.
+ Proficiency in After Effects and Premiere.
+ Ability to storyboard animation concepts.
+ Experience creating engaging motion graphics for various platforms.

* Video Editing:
+ Proficient in editing video content for multiple platforms.
+ Skill in ensuring narrative flow and brand consistency.
+ Up-to-date knowledge of current editing trends, techniques, and emerging tools.
+ Experience in post-production and FX.
+ Ability to adapt content for different digital formats and channels.

* Design:
+ Solid foundation in graphic design, including typography, layout, and composition.
+ Ability to support and interpret art direction across motion and static assets.
+ Comfortable contributing to visual concept development.
+ Strong collaboration skills with senior creatives.
+ Experience creating cohesive design systems across multiple touchpoints.

* Excellent client engagement skills with the ability to proactively organise and influence clients and build strong and effective working relationships
* An innate creative flair, interested in art direction and in developing concepting skills
* Strong knowledge of Adobe Creative Suite including Photoshop, Illustrator and InDesign.
* Strong typography, layout and technical skills with excellent attention to detail
* An understanding how to work across online banners (static and animated), social media posts (primarily Instagram and Facebook), web design, UI design, HTML email and storytelling
* An understanding of responsive design across all digital platforms
* An understanding of UX and latest Social and Digital technology trends
* Motion and video skills using After Effects, Premiere and Storyboarding Animation concepts
* Working on print-based collateral with great knowledge of branding
* The ability to talk through your ideas confidently with the team and clients
* Advanced proficiency in Microsoft Office and a keen interest in emerging technologies such as AI enhance project deliveries.
* Experience in consumer goods, luxury, or drinks and beverages sectors preferred.
* 8 + years of relevant experience in:
+ Digital
+ Motion Graphics
+ Web Design
+ Artwork
+ Production

title: Lead Product Manager
description:
**About Us**
 At Legora, we’re on a mission to transform the way lawyers work. Our AI-native platform lets legal professionals enhance their productivity and automate complex workflows. We collaborate closely with our clients and iterate at a market-leading pace. In a year, we have gone from an early MVP to tools used daily by thousands of lawyers, and are now scaling rapidly. We are here to win together with our team and clients, and carry the belief that life is too short not to accomplish something truly special.
   

  

 You are joining an early stage scale-up with exceptional product-market fit, trusted by global leaders like Bird & Bird, Pérez-Llorca, and Mannheimer Swartling. Backed by over $80M in funding from top investors including Benchmark, ICONIQ, Redpoint, and Y Combinator. And a a world-class team from Google, Klarna, Spotify, and top tier law firms with infinite room to grow professionally.
   

  

 The role
   

  

 We’re hiring multiple
 **Lead Product Managers** 
 across a range of teams—including Core Product, AI focused, Integrations and more. This is a high-impact opportunity to shape foundational parts of our product and deliver powerful experiences that transform the way legal work gets done.
   

  

 We are seeking experienced and passionate Lead Product Managers to join our dynamic team. In this role, you will lead a dedicated product area, taking full ownership of end-to-end workflows, and contribute to scaling our core infrastructure. We are looking for individuals who are energized by tackling complex challenges, thrive in a collaborative cross-functional environment, and are comfortable moving quickly in a culture of continuous learning and innovation. Your expertise will be crucial in driving product strategy, defining roadmaps, and ensuring successful execution to deliver impactful solutions.
   

  

**What You Will Be Doing**
* Lead the full product lifecycle for your area—from discovery to launch and iteration
* Define strategy, roadmap, and priorities in collaboration with your team and company leadership
* Turn complex user needs, technical inputs, and business goals into clear, actionable product requirements
* Work closely with engineering, AI, design, and go-to-market teams to build and ship world-class solutions
* Balance usability, scalability, and compliance in fast-changing contexts
* Track product performance through qualitative and quantitative signals—and iterate rapidly
* Help shape our product culture with a focus on user empathy, craftsmanship, and results
* Stay on top of AI, product, and legal tech trends that can inform our work


 Who you are
   

  

* You have several as a Product Manager, ideally in a high-growth or technical environment
* You’ve shipped complex products and are comfortable owning a product area end-to-end
* You have strong product sense and the ability to turn ambiguity into clarity and action
* You’re a collaborative team player who builds strong relationships with engineers, designers, and business stakeholders
* You’re analytical, curious, and driven to deliver impact
* You thrive in fast-paced environments where speed and quality go hand in hand
* You’re motivated by the chance to build tools that deeply improve how people work


 What's in it for you
   

  

* Career development opportunities in a rapidly evolving entrepreneurial environment.
* Direct collaboration with senior leadership and the opportunity to directly impact company growth and strategy.
* A collaborative, high-energy team environment where your ideas and contributions are valued and implemented.
* Competitive salary complemented with a transparent and highly competitive options program.
* Centrally located offices in Stockholm, designed as a space for you to do your life's work.


**We founded Legora to empower lawyers with the tools they truly deserve.**
 We’re not building for the way law is practiced today - we’re reimagining how it will be practiced tomorrow.

title: Technical Designer - ARC Raiders
description:
We are looking for a Technical Designer to join ARC Raiders game teams here at Embark, a team that is currently numbering ~100 developers.
   

  

 In this role you will be responsible for the technical design work by creating, implementing, and maintaining tools, systems, & other workflows as a bridge between design and code.
   

  

 You will collaborate closely with the Design Director and other Designers of the project, as well as Production leadership helping in articulating and establishing estimates, project scope and timelines.
   

  

**Example Of Responsibilities**
* Help design and prove new features by developing prototypes for the design team to experiment with
* Help identify technical pitfalls and challenges in our designs, offering possible solutions or alternatives
* Contribute tool and workflow improvement ideas, especially design tools
* Help design, balance, and tweak our more technical gameplay systems, for example activity spawning or loot distribution
* Work with other disciplines to help align design intent with non-design pipelines and tech


**We would love if you have**
* Around 5+ years of experience within technical design making games
* A good grasp of AAA PvP/PvE gameplay and systems design, including player psychology, UX design, and gameplay mechanics & dynamics
* Proficiency with the Unreal Engine and experience in scripting and blueprints
* Knowledge of the UnrealEngine-Angelscript plugin is a big plus, but not required
* Knowledge of programming languages such as C#, Lua, or Python
* A creative and curious mind
* A good knowledge or familiarity with other game making disciplines such as animation, UX, 3D Art, etc.
* A great creative collaborator in cross disciplinary groups
* Professional English communication skills


 At Embark we offer competitive salaries, passionate colleagues to share knowledge with and much more, but most of all we invite you to take part of a journey into the unknown, to build creative, surprising and beautiful experiences together.
   

  

 We welcome game makers of all sex, class, colour, age, gender identity, education, religion, opinion, culture, nation of origin, language, sexual orientation, shape, size, and ability.
   

  

 Did we leave anyone out? Well, we welcome you, too! We think that the gaming industry is made better when everyone has a seat at the table.
   

  

 Be yourself at Embark and make games while doing so. Please apply with confidence. We can’t wait to hear from you (in English)!

title: Game Director
description:
Job Title: Game Director
 



 Location: Sweden
 


 About Us
 
 We are a premium B2B iGaming studio focused on creating world-class online slot games for regulated global markets. Backed by deep industry experience and a passion for quality, we deliver captivating game experiences that combine cutting-edge design, performance, and commercial success.
 



 As we expand our portfolio and enter new markets, we are seeking a Game Director to take creative leadership across game development and ensure that every title we release exceeds expectations in innovation, quality, and market performance.
 


 Role Overview
 
 As Game Director, you will own the creative and gameplay vision across all game productions. From idea generation and game concepting to live tuning and performance review, you will guide and align teams around a clear creative direction. You will collaborate with product, art, math, and development leads to shape our portfolio and raise the bar for originality, engagement, and execution.
 



 This is a senior, hands-on leadership role where game sensibility meets business impact.
 


 Key Responsibilities:
 
 Game Vision & Portfolio Leadership
 


* Define and champion the creative vision and design direction for our slot game portfolio.
* Guide the creation of new game concepts that blend player engagement with market opportunity.
* Build a library of innovative, differentiated games that reflect our brand and excite our partners.



 Cross-Disciplinary Creative Direction
 


* Collaborate with Art Directors, Math Designers, Product Owners, and Engineers to turn high-level ideas into fully developed games.
* Ensure thematic consistency, visual quality, and gameplay clarity across all productions.
* Provide feedback at all stages—from early concept to final build—with a focus on polish and player experience.



 Game Quality & Player-Centric Thinking
 


* Ensure every game offers strong engagement loops, intuitive UX, and rewarding features.
* Balance game math, volatility, and mechanics to suit different player types and regional market needs.
* Stay ahead of iGaming trends, competitor titles, and player preferences to maintain creative relevance.



 Team Leadership & Collaboration
 


* Inspire and mentor Game Designers and Creative Producers, raising overall creative output and team cohesion.
* Work closely with the Product Director and Delivery Director to ensure smooth collaboration between creativity and execution.
* Participate in hiring, onboarding, and capability-building for creative functions.


 Qualifications & Experience:
 * 10+ years of experience in game design or creative direction, with 5+ years in leadership roles.
* Proven track record directing successful slot games or real-money iGaming products.
* Deep understanding of gameplay systems, player psychology, and slot design frameworks.
* A strong creative portfolio demonstrating high-quality game design, theming, and player-first thinking.
* Strong grasp of cross-functional development cycles in an Agile environment.
* Excellent communication and leadership skills—capable of uniting diverse teams around a single vision.
* Fluent in English; experience in working with international, multicultural teams is essential.
* Based in Sweden or open to relocation.



 Nice to Have:
 


* Experience in F2P/mobile games with live ops and monetization mechanics.
* Background in working with platform partners, operators, or regulatory bodies (GLI, MGA, etc.).
* Passion for innovation in UX, storytelling, or feature evolution within the iGaming space.


 What We Offer:
 * Competitive salary & performance bonuses – Your impact drives rewards.
* Creative freedom & supportive culture – Innovate with passionate colleagues.
* High-visibility titles – Build games played by millions worldwide.
* Growth opportunities – Advance with a fast-growing iGaming leader.

title: CPO till ClearOn
description:
Vill du vara med och leda produktutvecklingen i ett dynamiskt företag som står inför spännande tillväxtmöjligheter? Vi söker en erfaren och strategisk ledare till rollen som CPO (Head of Product) till ClearOn.
   

  

 Som CPO kommer du att ansvara för att forma och genomföra bolagets produktvision och leda ett team bestående av produktchefer och produktägare. Du kommer att spela en nyckelroll i ClearOn:s fortsatta tillväxt och ingå i företagets ledningsgrupp.
   

  

 I rollen kommer du att driva produktvisionen på ledningsnivå och samarbeta tätt med CEO och ledningsgruppen för att utveckla och förverkliga företagets strategi. Du är ansvarig för hela produktportföljen, inklusive affärsutveckling och innovation, med fokus på att säkerställa ClearOns kommersiella framgång och fortsatta utveckling.
   

  

 ClearOn:s kontor är beläget i Liljeholmen och du kommer rapportera till CEO.
   

  

**Dina huvudsakliga ansvarsområden:**
* Definiera och genomföra en produktvision i linje med företagets mål och affärsstrategi.
* Ansvara för ClearOns produkter och tjänster samt deras P&L.
* Leda och coacha ett team av produktchefer och produktägare för att främja en kultur av innovation och samarbete.
* Ansvara för att produktvision och roadmap skall möta dagens och morgondagens behov.
* Säkerställa effektiv kommunikation mellan olika avdelningar och produktteamet.
* Hantera produktutvecklingsprocesser för att säkerställa högkvalitativ och tidsenlig leverans.


**Kvalifikationer:**
* Minst 5 års erfarenhet inom produktledning, varav minst 2 år med ledarskap över produktchefer.
* Starka ledarskapsförmågor och erfarenhet av att inspirera och motivera team i snabbrörliga tekniska miljöer.
* Gedigen erfarenhet inom produktutveckling, marknadsföring och djup förståelse för SaaS-lösningar.
* Erfarenhet av datadriven produktutveckling, A/B-testning och användarundersökningar.
* Kunskap om agila metoder och SCRUM-ramverket.
* Meriterande om du har erfarenhet inom FMCG.


**Vi söker dig som:**
* Har förmåga att översätta marknadsbehov till strategiska produktplaner och balansera kortsiktiga och långsiktiga mål.
* Är lösningsorienterad, drivande och målinriktad med en stark förmåga att anpassa dig till förändringar.


**Om ClearOn**
 ClearOn är Sveriges marknadsledande partner för säljdrivande kampanjer både i butik och digital närvaro inom dagligvaru- och servicehandeln med över 50 års erfarenhet.
   

  

 Vi är en full servicepartner inom säljdrivande lösningar där vi erbjuder innovativa tekniska lösningar och interaktiva kampanjer som skapar engagemang och försäljning i butik.
   

  

 Vi arbetar utifrån ett 360 graders perspektiv och erbjuder strategisk rådgivning och analys och driver långsiktig tillväxt genom unika och konkurrenskraftiga erbjudanden och tjänster i strävan att nå vårt mål som en komplett partner för att förstå, aktivera och sammanföra varumärken med konsumenter.
   

  

**Frågor och kontakt**
 I denna rekrytering samarbetar ClearOn med Amendo Tech. Vid frågor om tjänsten är du välkommen att kontakta Johanna Hallenberg på johanna.hallenberg@amendotech.se. Vi ser fram emot att höra från dig!
   

  

**Om Amendo Tech**
 Amendo Tech är det självklara konsult- och rekryteringsföretaget inom tech, IT och digital utveckling.
   

  

 Amendo Tech är en del av Amendo Group som har arbetat med kompetensförsörjning sedan 2001. I koncernen ingår även Lagotto Executive Search & Interim som är specialiserade på executive search och interima tillsättningar av ledare och specialister, samt Amendo Bemanning och Rekrytering som erbjuder rekryterings- och konsultlösningar inom ekonomi, bank, finans, försäkring, HR och kommunikation.
   

  

 Följ gärna Amendo Tech på Linkedin.
   

  

 #IT

title: Property Manager Infotainment
description:
**Role Summary**
 For the group Software Defined Scania Driver (EGD) within Brand Identity Development (BID), we is looking för a Property Manager for Scania Infotainment property.
   

  

**Our Purpose** 
 : At Software Defined Scania, we are dedicated to accelerating the shift towards a software-defined Scania product. Our mission is to safeguard Scania's premium product value through customer-focused software functionality, driven by our motivated and curious employees in collaboration with TRATON Group R&D.
   

  

**Job Responsibilities**
* Infotainment System Development: Deliver quantified targets for designing and developing advanced infotainment systems that enhance the in-vehicle experience for drivers (and passengers) when driving and resting in the cab. Responsibility for the roadmap and current situation for the property.
* Requirements Management: Gathering, documenting, and managing requirements from stakeholders to ensure all needs are met.
* Validation and Testing: Conducting thorough validation and testing of infotainment systems to ensure they meet specified requirements and standards.
* Collaboration: Working closely with other teams and departments, such as hardware engineers, software developers, and UX designers, to ensure integrated solutions.
* User Interface and Experience: Secure intuitive and user-friendly interfaces that provide seamless interaction with infotainment features.
* Connectivity Solutions: Validate connectivity features such as Bluetooth, Wi-Fi, and mobile networks to ensure robust and reliable communication.
* Multimedia Integration: Incorporating multimedia functionalities including audio, video, and navigation systems to provide a comprehensive infotainment experience.
* Software Updates and Maintenance: Ensuring that infotainment systems are regularly updated and maintained to meet the latest standards and customer expectations.
* Customer Feedback and Improvement: Gathering and analysing customer feedback to continuously improve infotainment systems and address any issues.
* Market and Competitor Analysis: Monitoring market trends and competitors to ensure our Scania infotainment systems remain competitive and relevant for our customers' needs.


**Who You Are**
* Expertise in Infotainment Systems: Extensive knowledge and experience in developing and managing infotainment systems in automotive applications.
* User Interface Design: Proficiency in designing user interfaces that are intuitive and enhance user experience.
* Connectivity Technologies: Familiarity with connectivity solutions such as Bluetooth, Wi-Fi, and mobile networks.
* Multimedia Integration: Experience in integrating multimedia functionalities including audio, video, and navigation systems.
* Software Development: Strong background in software development, particularly in the context of infotainment systems.
* Customer-Centric Approach: Genuine interest in understanding and addressing customer needs and preferences.
* Analytical Skills: Ability to analyse operational data and customer feedback to drive continuous improvement.
* Market Awareness: Awareness of market trends and competitor analysis to ensure our products remain competitive.
* Communication Skills: Strong verbal, written, and rhetorical communication skills.
* Versatility: Ability to handle various tasks and responsibilities effectively.
* Valid Driving License: Required for testing and development purposes.


 We welcome applicants from all backgrounds – your unique experience and perspectives is valuable to us.
   

  

**This Is Us**
 We foster a culture of innovation, collaboration, and continuous improvement. Achieved by motivated and curious employees living the Scania way. We encourage open communication, creativity, and proactive problem-solving.
   

  

**Scania Offers**
 We offer a dynamic, flexible workplace with hybrid work options, including Scania Sergel and Midway hubs. With a structured development plan and courses, Scania supports your career growth both locally and internationally.
   

  

 Benefits include training at our health center Gröndal or wellness allowance, result bonus, flexible hours, and company car leasing. Scania also hosts events for employees and their families, and Stockholm residents enjoy direct access to Södertälje via Scania Job express buses.
   

  

**Application**
 Your application should include a CV and any relevant certificates. We welcome all applicants and strive for diversity in our recruitment processes.
   

  

 Apply as soon as possible, no later than 2025-08-25. Screening will take place on an ongoing basis during the application period. Logical and personality tests may be used as part of the selection process, and a background check may be required for this role.
   

  

 If you have questions or would like more information, please contact:
   

  

 recruiting manager, Niclas Evertsson (niclas.evertsson@scania.com).
   

  

 We look forward to your application!

title: Business Analyst to Channel Development within Cash Management
job_function: Business Development, Analyst, and Information Technology
company_industry: Banking and IT Services and IT Consulting
description:
Our team is on a mission to deliver user friendly and efficient payment solutions to meet the needs of our corporate customers in Swedish digital channels.
   

  

 About the team:
   

  

* Team consists of software engineers with well balanced level of experience and different focuses from Front-End, Back-End development to testing (manual, automated), Business Analysts with high focus on quality and outcome of deliveries
* Team is spread across two locations, Vilnius and Stockholm. So, travelling few times a year might apply
* We are a friendly and supportive team that lives Swedbank values: Open, Simple, Caring


 Role responsibilities:
   

  

 Main responsibility of the Business Analyst is to gather requirements, analyse and document it in a structured way, refine together with development team to secure it is understood by all team members and ensure quality of the delivery
   

  

* You will collaborate with Product Owners, Product Specialists and other Stakeholders and gather requirements in order to understand the needs and objectives of the delivery
* You will conduct workshops, interviews and meetings to gather detail requirements and document those in Jira, Confluence etc.
* You will lead refinement meetings together with development team to secure the understanding of requirements, needs and objectives
* You will work closely with UX designers and solution architects to ensure solution meets both user needs and business objectives
* You will continuously evalute delivered solutions for any improvements or enhancements
* You will be part of maintenance and incident handling routine
* Together with the team, you will constantly strive to improve our ways of working


 What is needed in this role:
   

  

* Experience in the role as Business Analyst (preferably in the banking payments domain)
* Strong analytical skills
* Excellent communication abilities
* Curiosity and attention to the details
* Capacity to balance both requirements and deliveries from a helicopter view as well as ability to deep dive into the details
* Strong sense of ownership and a drive to gain domain knowledge
* Self-driven, solution-oriented, with a positive can-do attitude and value driven mindset
* Understanding of Software Development Life Cycle


 With us, you can experience:
   

  

* Personal and professional growth through self-leadership and continuous development
* Meaningful work that positively impacts our workplace, our customers, and society
* An open and collaborative culture that encourages cross-functional teamwork and provides networking opportunities
* A supportive and inclusive environment that promotes a balanced and sustainable work-life, with flexible working conditions when suitable for the role
* Benefits such as our share based reward program Eken, company pension plan, employee offer for banking products, health insurance


 " Join our team and...
   

  

 be a part of an international team of professionals, who are jointly delivering challenging projects, maximizing customer value and increasing Swedbank’s competitive advantage."
 **Mindaugas Kniukšta – Competence Lead**
 We look forward to your application at 01.08.2025 the latest
   

  

**Contacts:** 
 Recruiting manager: Mindaugas Kniuksta, +37069840341
   

  

*If you are to be employed in Lithuania, please note that the salary offered for this position ranges from 3
 *,300–5,100 €* 
 gross i.e. before taxes. Read more here.*
****Swedbank does not discriminate anybody based on gender, age, sexual orientation or sexual identity, ethnicity, religion or disability – everybody is welcome.****

title: Lead Game Designer - Games
description:
We are looking for a talented and experienced Lead Game Designer to join THE FINALS game team here at Embark, a team that is currently numbering around ~100 developers.
   

  

 As a Lead Game Designer at Embark, you will be responsible for detailed design work on the project, as well as instigating and reviewing the designs of other designers. You will collaborate closely with the directors of the project, in refining concepts and ideas into tangible designs, prototypes and features, as well as working with Production leadership in helping in articulating and establishing estimates, project scope and timelines.
   

  

 We would like you to take on managerial responsibilities for some of the projects’ Design staff, as well as coach and mentor the projects Game Designers in design methodology and documentation practices. And inspire them to deliver high quality, balanced and scalable systems and player experiences, fitting for Live Service and Free-to-play PvP Action Games.
   

  

 You will also own and spearhead game features directly, and work hands-on in cross disciplinary teams while implementing gameplay features
   

  

**We would love if you have**
* A creative and curious mind.
* 10+ years of experience designing and making games and a proven track record with multiple shipped titles.
* An excellent grasp of AAA PvP gameplay and systems design, including knowledge of player psychology, UX design, gameplay mechanics and dynamics.
* Proficiency with the Unreal Engine and experience with Blueprints and scripting.
* Able to adapt to varied learning and communication styles of team members and stakeholders.
* A good knowledge and familiarity with the various game maker disciplines, coding, animation, game physics, 3D Art, etc.
* Enjoyment of creative collaboration in cross disciplinary groups.
* Professional English communication skills.


 At Embark we offer competitive salaries, passionate colleagues to share knowledge with and much more, but most of all we invite you to take part of a journey into the unknown, to build creative, surprising and beautiful experiences together.
   

  

 We welcome game makers of all sex, class, colour, age, gender identity, education, religion, opinion, culture, nation of origin, language, sexual orientation, shape, size, and ability.
   

  

 Did we leave anyone out? Well, we welcome you, too! We think that the gaming industry is made better when everyone has a seat at the table.
   

  

 Be yourself at Embark and make games while doing so. Please apply with confidence. We can’t wait to hear from you (in English)!

title: Senior Software Engineer, Platform Monitoring | Sweden | Remote
description:
Grafana Labs is a remote-first, open-source powerhouse. There are more than 20M users of Grafana, the open source visualization tool, around the globe, monitoring everything from beehives to climate change in the Alps. The instantly recognizable dashboards have been spotted everywhere from a NASA launch and Minecraft HQ to Wimbledon and the Tour de France. Grafana Labs also helps more than 3,000 companies - including Bloomberg, JPMorgan Chase, and eBay - manage their observability strategies with the Grafana LGTM Stack, which can be run fully managed with Grafana Cloud or self-managed with the Grafana Enterprise Stack, both featuring scalable metrics (Grafana Mimir), logs (Grafana Loki), and traces (Grafana Tempo).



We’re scaling fast and staying true to what makes us different: an open-source legacy, a global collaborative culture, and a passion for meaningful work. Our team thrives in an innovation-driven environment where transparency, autonomy, and trust fuel everything we do.



You may not meet every requirement, and that’s okay. If this role excites you, we’d love you to raise your hand for what could be a truly career-defining opportunity.

**This is a remote position and we're considering candidates in Sweden.**


**The Opportunity:**



We are hiring for the Platform Productivity squad. The squad is mostly responsible for helping our internal engineers release their software onto our infrastructure, in secure and measurable ways. They lead automation of the release processes (anywhere from CI/CD to bootstrapping) and help our internal engineering teams get on board with them using ‘golden path’ techniques, but also helping edge cases and making sure that teams can get the most out of our tools.



At the end of the day, we’re the Platform Team for the teams that are building some of the most cherished observability tools– from Grafana, Mimir and Loki, to Tempo.


**What You’ll Be Doing:**



The squad is responsible for setting its own roadmap, and as a part of the team you'll have a part to play in that process. You'll help us maintain, improve and extend what we already have. You'll be involved in choosing what we focus on next and, just as importantly, when and how to gracefully sunset systems which are no longer needed. Your responsibilities will also include helping the team to design, compare, and choose appropriate solutions for (at least some) of the following things:


* Development and maintenance of our Internal Engineering Platform (IEP)
* CI/CD platform management and development
* Build, release and deployment automation
* Application configuration management tooling
* “Up to date” software automation
* Artefact management
* Working with diverse internal teams, from application development to security, to support implementation of their requirements
* Being part of an on-call rotation to support Platform tooling

  


**What Makes You a Great Fit:**



You enjoy working with engineers, as well as with the management structures that are there to support you and enable you and your team to do your very best.



You are **comfortable working in a remote-first company**; communication is key. For us, working together means being collaborative, friendly, kind, and respectful. We operate by consensus, you can contribute to a discussion but then commit to the team decision.



You are eager to **learn and grow**. There is a lot of room for growth and development, and the team has quite a lot of knowledge to share for those who are wanting to learn.



You approach development holistically. The team owns the full life cycle of our code; from writing design docs, looking at developer feedback, testing and deployment, all the way through to decommissioning. We appreciate engineers who enjoy looking at the big picture, and also notice the details of the brush strokes. You're a flexible software engineer. In a typical day, we might spend time responding to incidents, integrating existing systems, or designing and implementing our own systems. While our primary language is Go, we value flexibility and we'll choose the best tool for the job, even if that is a shell script.



You have experience with **operating your code**. Since a lot of operators and developers use our software, having some grounding in both of these spaces really helps us with building better platforms for our users. Kubernetes and Docker are what we use, mostly. We also work with a lot of Infrastructure as Code, so be sure to check out grafana/tanka.


* Engineering/software development experience within a Platform group delivering services to internal engineering teams
* Experience working in a cloud environment
* Infrastructure as Code with Terraform/Crossplane.
* Familiarity with Kubernetes administration - very cool if experience with Tanka.
* Experience/Interest in implementing, integrating, and maintaining observability systems and processes


In Sweden, the base compensation range for this role is SEK 738,518 - SEK 886,222. Actual compensation may vary based on level, experience, and skillset as assessed in the interview process. Benefits include equity, bonus (if applicable) and other benefits listed here.


* *Compensation ranges are country specific. If you are applying for this role from a different location than listed above, your recruiter will discuss your specific market’s defined pay range & benefits at the beginning of the process.*


**Why You’ll Thrive at Grafana Labs:**


* **100% Remote, Global Culture -** As a remote-only company, we bring together talent from around the world, united by a culture of collaboration and shared purpose.
* **Scaling Organization** – Tackle meaningful work in a high-growth, ever-evolving environment.
* **Transparent Communication** – Expect open decision-making and regular company-wide updates.
* **Innovation-Driven** – Autonomy and support to ship great work and try new things.
* **Open Source Roots** – Built on community-driven values that shape how we work.
* **Empowered Teams** – High trust, low ego culture that values outcomes over optics.
* **Career Growth Pathways** – Defined opportunities to grow and develop your career.
* **Approachable Leadership** – Transparent execs who are involved, visible, and human.
* **Passionate People** – Join a team of smart, supportive folks who care deeply about what they do.
* **In-Person onboarding** - We want you to thrive from day 1 with your fellow new ‘Grafanistas’ to learn all about what we do and how we do it.
* **Balance is Key** - We operate a global annual leave policy of 30 days per annum. 3 days of your annual leave entitlement are reserved for Grafana Shutdown Days to allow the team to really disconnect. *\*We will comply with local legislation where applicable.*


**Equal Opportunity Employer:** We will recruit, train, compensate and promote regardless of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, disability, age, veteran status, and all the other fascinating characteristics that make us different and unique. We believe that equality and diversity builds a strong organization and we’re working hard to make sure that’s the foundation of our organization as we grow.


*Grafana Labs may utilize AI tools in its recruitment process to assist in matching information provided in CVs to job postings. The recruitment team will continue to review inbound CVs manually to identify alignment with current openings.*



#LI-Remote



*For information about how your personal data is used once you’ve applied to a job, check out our* *privacy policy**.*
company_description: Grafana Labs is the company behind Grafana, the leading open source software for visualizing time series data.

title: Software Engineer, Flight Software
description:
At Heart Aerospace we are developing the ES-30, a regional hybrid-electric airplane with a capacity of 30 passengers, an electric zero-emission range of 200 km and an extended hybrid range of 400 km. Heart is targeting type certification of the ES-30 by the end of the decade.


**Your mission**



As a Software Engineer on the Flight Software Team, you are responsible for all aspects the development of the software on the aircraft. You will interface with other engineers to develop and understand requirements, architect and writing high quality code, build tests and test infrastructure, documentation, and provide support through the software lifecycle. You will report to the Manager of Flight Software and collaborate with other engineers as part of a multi-functional team. As an early software hire within the organization, part of your responsibility will be to lay the technological foundation for the aircraft software and supporting systems, including but not limited to implementing aircraft control functions on embedded systems, developing aircraft models and simulation tools, implementing critical fault tolerance mechanisms, and building hardware and software test systems.


**Key responsibilities include but are not limited to:**


* Testing and validation of the software that controls aircraft systems, ensuring they meet the safety and performance standards.
* Designing test plans, execute tests, analyze results, and work with other engineers and pilots to identify and resolve issues.
* Running tests using various methods, including simulations, hardware-in-the-loop testing, and flight testing.
* Working with other engineers and stakeholders to ensure flight software meets requirements and safety standards.


**Skills & Requirements**
-------------------------

**You'll Bring These Qualifications:**


* Bachelor's or above in computer science, electrical engineering, or similar engineering discipline.
* 3+ years professional experience writing safety-critical code for vehicles, or similar applications.
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English.
* Passion for aircraft and Heart’s mission.


**These Qualifications Would Be Nice to Have:**


* Significant experience writing software in Rust, Python, C, C++, or a similar systems language.
* Experience writing code for execution in an embedded environment (microcontrollers, bare metal, RTOS, embedded OS).
* Experience modeling cyber-physical systems (6 DoF Simulators, Monte Carlos, Battery Pack Models).
* Strong systems design fundamentals. Experience architecting software systems (and contributing requirements to hardware design) for vehicle systems. Experience with various approaches to fault tolerance and fault mitigation.
* Significant experience with software and hardware test development. Experience with unit tests, CI/CD, integration testing, data collection and management, report generation, fuzzing and other advanced automated test methods.
* Experience developing software under a functional safety compliant process (for example, compliant to IEC 61508, ISO 26262, DO-178C, or similar). Strong understanding of functional safety and how to apply it to software development.


Heart Aerospace has a clear mission. We work to decarbonize and democratize air travel. We believe in electrification. Not only to bring down emissions and build a sustainable future, but to make flying accessible for the many, around the world.



Electric planes are cheaper to operate and can unlock convenient and effective regional traveling, a market that today is restricted by the difficulty of making a sustainable profit. Our mission is about taking electrification to the skies, helping our customers build their businesses, and the traveling public to access an amazing and sustainable service.



Working at Heart Aerospace is not just a career; it is a chance to directly make the world more accessible and sustainable. Come help us write a new chapter in the history of aviation together!



We seek experienced and skilled professionals to join our fast-moving team developing a new electric aircraft. We’re in a very expansive phase and now is the time to join our team! Visit our **career site** and check out what it is like working at Heart.


*Heart Aerospace is committed to equal employment opportunity and providing reasonable accommodations to qualified candidates and employees pursuant to applicable law. We value and encourage diversity and solicit applications from all qualified applicants without regard to race, color, gender, sex, age, religion, creed, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, marital status, sexual orientation, physical or mental disability, medical condition, gender identity or expression, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by law.*



Heart Aerospace participates in E-Verify.

title: VR Sverige söker IT Test Lead
description:
Stockholms län, Nacka
29 dagar kvar
**VR Sverige söker IT Test Lead**
=================================


Ansök senast: 2025-08-31
**Om VR Sverige**



På VR arbetar vi tillsammans för världens bästa kollektivtrafik. På den svenska marknaden bedriver vi busstrafik och tågtrafik på det nationella tågnätet. Tillsammans med våra kollegor i Finland är vi en av de största operatörerna inom kollektivtrafik i Norden. Vårt mål är att öka vår konkurrensförmåga genom att jobba med utveckling och innovationer samt förbättrad operativ kvalitet. Vi arbetar utifrån våra värderingar Vi bryr oss, Vi arbetar tillsammans och Vi bidrar till utveckling.


**Om rollen**



Vi söker en erfaren och drivande IT Test Lead som vill ta ett helhetsansvar för vårt testarbete. Rollen innebär att du arbetar full-stack inom test, från att välja metoder och verktyg till att själv utföra tester. Du leder och utvecklar testverksamheten och har ett övergripande ansvar för kravhanteringen, testprocesser, testverktyg och arbetssätt. Som IT Test Lead driver du även tekniska projekt och implementeringar och säkerställer att testning sker enligt högsta kvalitetsstandard. Du fungerar som en viktig länk mellan IT och verksamheten och har lätt för att anpassa kommunikation efter sammanhang, där du samlar in krav, kommunicerar testresultat och ser till att alla delar i projektet är i fas.


**Huvudsakliga arbetsuppgifter**


* Leda planering, design, samordning och genomförande av teststrategier för olika system och applikationer.
* Utföra funktionella och icke-funktionella tester för system, applikationer, gränssnitt och integrationer.
* Ansvara för testverktyg, testautomatisering och metodval
* Identifiera risker, föreslå förbättringar och implementera best practices inom test.
* Samarbeta med verksamheten och andra intressenter för att samla in krav, översätta dessa till testfall och säkerställa god kvalitet.
* Upprätta och underhålla testplaner, testfall och dokumentation.


**Dina egenskaper**



För att du ska trivas i rollen hos oss tror vi att du är en person som tar initiativ och gärna äger dina arbetsuppgifter från start till mål. Du är strukturerad, kvalitetsmedveten och har ett öga för detaljer. Du har förmågan att vara analytisk och samtidigt kunna växla till operativt arbete och du trivs i en roll där du samarbetar med både tekniska team och verksamhetsnära parter. Du har ett lösningsorienterat förhållningssätt och gillar att bidra till förbättring och utveckling i en dynamisk miljö.


**Kvalifikationer**


* Minst 5 års erfarenhet av testledning och teknisk projektledning.
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta med kravhantering och testledning i komplexa systemmiljöer.
* Djup förståelse för applikations- och systemarkitektur.
* Goda kunskaper i olika testmetoder, verktyg och testautomatisering.
* Relevant högskoleutbildning inom IT, datavetenskap eller liknande.
* Mycket goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska, både muntligt och skriftligt.


**Det är meriterande om du har**


* Certifiering inom testning, exempelvis ISTQB
* Projektledarcertifiering såsom PMP eller motsvarande
* Erfarenhet av mobiliseringsprojekt och test i driftsättningsfasen


**Placering**



Tjänstens placering är vid vårt huvudkontor i Stockholm, beläget på Sicklastråket 4 i Nacka.


**Övrigt**



Vill du bli en del av VR? Skicka in ditt CV via länken nedan. Vi kallar till intervjuer löpande och tjänsten kan komma att tillsättas innan sista ansökningsdag.

title: Senior C++ Software Engineer (100% remote)
description:
***Join Tether and Shape the Future of Digital Finance***


At Tether, we’re not just building products, we’re pioneering a global financial revolution. Our cutting-edge solutions empower businesses—from exchanges and wallets to payment processors and ATMs—to seamlessly integrate reserve-backed tokens across blockchains. By harnessing the power of blockchain technology, Tether enables you to store, send, and receive digital tokens instantly, securely, and globally, all at a fraction of the cost. Transparency is the bedrock of everything we do, ensuring trust in every transaction.

***Innovate with Tether***

**Tether Finance:** Our innovative product suite features the world’s most trusted stablecoin, **USDT**, relied upon by hundreds of millions worldwide, alongside pioneering digital asset tokenization services.


But that’s just the beginning:

**Tether Power:** Driving sustainable growth, our energy solutions optimize excess power for Bitcoin mining using eco-friendly practices in state-of-the-art, geo-diverse facilities.

**Tether Data:** Fueling breakthroughs in AI and peer-to-peer technology, we reduce infrastructure costs and enhance global communications with cutting-edge solutions like **KEET**, our flagship app that redefines secure and private data sharing.

**Tether Education**: Democratizing access to top-tier digital learning, we empower individuals to thrive in the digital and gig economies, driving global growth and opportunity.

**Tether Evolution**: At the intersection of technology and human potential, we are pushing the boundaries of what is possible, crafting a future where innovation and human capabilities merge in powerful, unprecedented ways.

***Why Join Us?***


Our team is a global talent powerhouse, working remotely from every corner of the world. If you’re passionate about making a mark in the fintech space, this is your opportunity to collaborate with some of the brightest minds, pushing boundaries and setting new standards. We’ve grown fast, stayed lean, and secured our place as a leader in the industry.


If you have excellent English communication skills and are ready to contribute to the most innovative platform on the planet, Tether is the place for you.

**Are you ready to be part of the future?**

**About the job**


At Tether, we're committed to making advanced AI technologies more accessible. Thanks to its investment in AI infrastructure, starting from Northern Data, Tether is now in a prime position to tackle ambitious AI projects. Our goal is to build the next generation of AI models, leading innovation in AI, through an accessible, transparent and privacy preserving approach.


The role involves building AI solutions across the spectrum from large-scale models designed for advanced applications to smaller, highly performant models tailored for efficiency on edge devices such as mobile phones and laptops.


Our dynamic team operates entirely remotely, uniting talent from every corner of the globe. Our journey has been marked by rapid growth and efficient operations, firmly establishing us as pioneers within the industry. Join us in building AI models and solutions that not only compete with but exceed the capabilities of current leaders, driving both technological advancement and broad accessibility.

**Responsibilities**

* Work on low level libraries and modules in various domains.
* Collaborate closely with researchers to assist in coding, training and transitioning models from research to production environments.
* Integrate AI features into existing products, enriching them with the latest advancements in machine learning.

* 5+ years of experience working with C and C++.
* Experience working in low level OS / Systems / Kernel development.
* Experience in low level networking
* Knowledge of other languages such as Rust and Javascript.
* Demonstrated ability to rapidly assimilate new technologies and techniques.
* A degree in Computer Science complemented by a solid track record in development.

**Important information for candidates**  

Recruitment scams have become increasingly common. To protect yourself, please keep the following in mind when applying for roles:

* **Apply only through our official channels.** We do not use third-party platforms or agencies for recruitment unless clearly stated. All open roles are listed on our official careers page: https://tether.recruitee.com/
* **Verify the recruiter’s identity.** All our recruiters have verified LinkedIn profiles. If you’re unsure, you can confirm their identity by checking their profile or contacting us through our website.
* **Be cautious of unusual communication methods.** We do not conduct interviews over WhatsApp, Telegram, or SMS. All communication is done through official company emails and platforms.
* **Double-check email addresses.** All communication from us will come from emails ending in **@**tether.to **or @**tether.io
* **We will never request payment or financial details.** If someone asks for personal financial information or payment at any point during the hiring process, it is a scam. Please report it immediately.

**When in doubt, feel free to reach out through our official website.**

title: IT Sourcing & Vendor Manager
description:
Vill du vara med och implementera framtidens inköp där vi skapar en kostnadseffektiv och affärsnära verksamhet? Vi söker erfarna och engagerade IT Sourcing & Vendor Manager som vill vara med och forma våra strategiska leverantörsrelationer. I denna nyckelroll har du ett övergripande ansvar för att utveckla och implementera sourcing strategier som optimerar våra IT-leverantörsrelationer.



Uppdraget passar dig som har erfarenhet av strategiskt inköp och leverantörsstyrning. Här får du vara med och påverka affären, driva förbättringar och skapa värde i nära samarbete med verksamheten och våra leverantörer. Du bidrar med din kompetens i en komplex och dynamisk miljö där du får leda upphandlingar, utmana arbetssätt och utveckla starka leverantörsrelationer.


**Det här gör du som IT Sourcing & Vendor Manager på Folksam**
--------------------------------------------------------------



Som IT Sourcing & Vendor Manager kommer du att tilldelas ansvarsområden för vilket du utvecklar, förankrar och implementerar sourcing strategier tillsammans med kollegor inom inköp samt verksamheten.



Du ansvarar för att vår verksamhet får professionellt stöd vid upphandlingar, omförhandlingar samt förvaltar och utvecklar löpande långsiktiga relationer med våra strategiska IT-leverantörer.



I rollen finns en stor förväntan på strategisk/taktisk höjd. Du arbetar affärsmässigt och med stor integritet, där du säkerställer att vi har effektiva och välfungerande processer genom hela leverantörslivscykeln. Du skapar tydlighet och struktur, och ser till att alla parter både internt och externt har en gemensam förståelse för förväntningar och ansvar.

  


Huvudsakliga arbetsuppgifter:


* Du är proaktiv och har en ledande roll genom hela leverantörslivscykeln från upphandling, implementation, uppföljning och fram till avveckling av leverantörer.
* Driva upphandlingar, förhandla och sluta uppdragsavtal, ramavtal och avtal.
* Du etablerar strukturerad leverantörsstyrning och bygger långsiktiga leverantörsrelationer.
* Du skapar förutsättningarna för en strukturerad och kontrollerad dialog med våra leverantörer genom att leda samverkansforum och agera fokalpunkt i leverantörsrelationen.
* Du främjar en kultur av effektiv kommunikation och tydlighet, både internt och externt, för att säkerställa att alla parter förstår förväntningar och ansvar.
* Du tar fram och implementerar leverantörsstrategier i samverkan med sakägare.
* Du utbildar och coachar kollegor och driver en kultur inom Folksam som präglas av professionalism, affärsmässighet och starka leverantörssamarbeten.
* Du samarbetar tätt med andra avdelningar inom Folksam för att förstå deras övergripande mål och strategi samt för att säkerställa intern samordning och optimering av våra leverantörssamarbeten med syfte att maximera utfallet av varje investerad krona.

**Är du den vi söker?**
-----------------------



För att lyckas i rollen behöver du som person ha hög integritet, driv och ett stort engagemang för att skapa värde både i affären och för våra kunder.



Du är serviceinriktad, självgående, analytisk, lyhörd och trivs i en miljö där förändring är en naturlig del av vardagen. Du gillar att tänka strategiskt, samtidigt som du får saker att hända. Vidare har du en skicklighet i relationsbyggande som gör att du upplevs förtroendeingivande. Du kan effektivt engagera och påverka olika intressenter.



Du har ett pragmatiskt arbetssätt och enkelhet att förklara komplexa ämnen på ett enkelt sätt. Du har en stark förändringsvilja och brinner för att bidra till Folksams utveckling



Vi ser också att du har


* arbetat minst åtta år med Sourcing och/eller Vendor Management inom IT
* erfarenhet av att driva framgångsrika förhandlingar och komplexa sourcingprojekt inom IT-området
* förmågan att både läsa och skriva komplexa IT-avtal för att kunna vara rådgivande vid tolkningsfrågor
* behärskar affärsengelska och -svenska i tal och skrift
* relevant utbildning från högskola eller universitet inom juridik, ekonomi eller teknik
* erfarenhet från bank- och/eller försäkringsbranschen eller annan reglerad verksamhet är meriterande
* kunskap om SAFe och/eller andra agila metoder är meriterande.

**Här kan du göra skillnad**
----------------------------



Välkommen till Folksam – här driver du viktiga frågor framåt. Från de avgörande detaljerna till de stora perspektiven, med fokus på att förenkla våra kunders vardag. Det gör att du bidrar till något större, oavsett roll. Här finns det många roliga, utvecklande jobb och du har goda chanser till en spännande karriär.  

  

Vi tror på ett hållbart arbetsliv och jobbar aktivt med inkludering och mångfald. Våra moderna kontor bjuder in till samarbete och lärande, här får vi saker att hända! Du har flexibiliteten att kunna varva arbete på kontoret med att jobba hemifrån, utifrån verksamhetens behov.



Läs mer och se filmer om livet hos oss på folksam.se/jobb-och-karriar.


**Så söker du jobbet**
----------------------



Välkommen att skicka in din ansökan senast 24 augusti 2025.



Vi ser fram emot att få veta mer om dina kompetenser för det här jobbet. I denna rekrytering kommer vi inte efterfråga ett personligt brev. Du som kandidat kommer få svara på ett antal frågor som fokuserar på de erfarenheter och kompetenser som är viktiga i just detta jobb. I samband med din ansökan ber vi dig därför bifoga ditt CV och besvara frågorna. Vid första urval kommer vi endast att utgå ifrån denna information. Vi önskar att du svarar konkret och kortfattat, och att det finns en tydlig koppling mellan dina svar och ditt CV.



Vill du veta mer om jobbet är du välkommen att kontakta Piya Hossain, 070- 989 15 50.



Fackliga representanter: Akademikerföreningen Ann-Louise Andersson 070-831 61 44, Forena Anneli Ersson 070-831 69 22 och Handels Mikael A Carlsson 070-831 51 32.


*Kundägda Folksamgruppen erbjuder sparande och försäkringar som ger trygghet i livets alla skeden. Sedan 1908 gör vi det enklare för våra fyra miljoner kunder att känna sig trygga i en hållbar värld genom rätt försäkringar, rätt sparande och rätt hjälp när något händer.*

title: VR Sverige söker IT Test Lead
description:
Om VR Sverige
  
  

På VR arbetar vi tillsammans för världens bästa kollektivtrafik. På den svenska marknaden bedriver vi busstrafik och tågtrafik på det nationella tågnätet. Tillsammans med våra kollegor i Finland är vi en av de största operatörerna inom kollektivtrafik i Norden. Vårt mål är att öka vår konkurrensförmåga genom att jobba med utveckling och innovationer samt förbättrad operativ kvalitet. Vi arbetar utifrån våra värderingar Vi bryr oss, Vi arbetar tillsammans och Vi bidrar till utveckling.
  
  

Om rollen
  
  

Vi söker en erfaren och drivande IT Test Lead som vill ta ett helhetsansvar för vårt testarbete. Rollen innebär att du arbetar full-stack inom test, från att välja metoder och verktyg till att själv utföra tester. Du leder och utvecklar testverksamheten och har ett övergripande ansvar för kravhanteringen, testprocesser, testverktyg och arbetssätt. Som IT Test Lead driver du även tekniska projekt och implementeringar och säkerställer att testning sker enligt högsta kvalitetsstandard. Du fungerar som en viktig länk mellan IT och verksamheten och har lätt för att anpassa kommunikation efter sammanhang, där du samlar in krav, kommunicerar testresultat och ser till att alla delar i projektet är i fas.
  
  

Huvudsakliga arbetsuppgifter
  
  

* Leda planering, design, samordning och genomförande av teststrategier för olika system och applikationer.
* Utföra funktionella och icke-funktionella tester för system, applikationer, gränssnitt och integrationer.
* Ansvara för testverktyg, testautomatisering och metodval
* Identifiera risker, föreslå förbättringar och implementera best practices inom test.
* Samarbeta med verksamheten och andra intressenter för att samla in krav, översätta dessa till testfall och säkerställa god kvalitet.
* Upprätta och underhålla testplaner, testfall och dokumentation.


Dina egenskaper
  
  

För att du ska trivas i rollen hos oss tror vi att du är en person som tar initiativ och gärna äger dina arbetsuppgifter från start till mål. Du är strukturerad, kvalitetsmedveten och har ett öga för detaljer. Du har förmåga att växla mellan strategi och praktiskt arbete och trivs i en roll där du får samarbeta med både tekniska team och verksamhetsnära parter. Du har ett lösningsorienterat förhållningssätt och gillar att bidra till förbättring och utveckling i en dynamisk miljö.
  
  

Kvalifikationer
  
  

* Minst 5 års erfarenhet av testledning och teknisk projektledning.
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta med kravhantering och testledning i komplexa systemmiljöer.
* Djup förståelse för applikations- och systemarkitektur.
* Goda kunskaper i olika testmetoder, verktyg och testautomatisering.
* Relevant högskoleutbildning inom IT, datavetenskap eller liknande.
* Mycket goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska, både muntligt och skriftligt.


Det är meriterande om du har
  
  

* Certifiering inom testning, exempelvis ISTQB
* Projektledarcertifiering såsom PMP eller motsvarande
* Erfarenhet av mobiliseringsprojekt och test i driftsättningsfasen


Placering
  
  

Tjänstens placering är vid vårt huvudkontor i Stockholm, beläget på Sicklastråket 4 i Nacka.
  
  

Övrigt
  
  

Vill du bli en del av VR? Skicka in ditt CV via länken nedan. Vi kallar till intervjuer löpande och tjänsten kan komma att tillsättas innan sista ansökningsdag.
